intro: Cissampelos tetrandra, commonly known as the four-threaded cissampelos, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in axillary inflorescences. Its fruit is a fleshy, orange-colored capsule that splits open to release seeds. Cissampelos tetrandra is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks.
